description:
Childhood experiences, both good and bad, contribute to our core beliefs. These become behaviors and habits that stay with us for a lifetime. As adults, we often unwittingly support these limiting beliefs.

In this course, discover that your core beliefs are not necessarily 100% valid.

When stuck or overwhelmed, people use internal resources or external soothers to cope. Although such automatic coping mechanisms might offer short-term relief, they can also bring long-term distress.

Find out what causes self-sabotage and learn how to initiate the process of change. Gain deeper understanding of the whens, whys, and hows of your behavior. Become better prepared to accept and embrace change.
title: Beliefs & Behaviors: Childhood Imprinting & Self-Sabotage
